intro: Centaurea paxorum, commonly known as the Alpine centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, sunny conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces bright blue or purple flowers. Centaurea paxorum is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
